greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least number k > 0 such that sigma(k/n) = phi(k).
example: For n=11, the least number is 1848. In fact, sigma(1848/11) = phi(1848) = 480.
maple: for k from 1 to q do for n from k by k to q do
if sigma(n/k)=phi(n) then print(n); break; fi;
program: (Perl) use Math::Prime::Util qw/:all/; for $k (1..29) { $i=1; $i++ while divisor_sum($i) != euler_phi($i*$k); say "$k  ",$i*$k; } # _Dana Jacobsen_, May 02 2014
results.author: _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 28 2014
